segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 5
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 5

segments.pli: 5. Muṇḍarājavagga
segments.en: 5. With King Muṇḍa

segments.pli: 43. Iṭṭhasutta
segments.en: 43. Likable

segments.pli: Atha kho anāthapiṇḍiko gahapati yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho anāthapiṇḍikaṃ gahapatiṃ bhagavā etadavoca:
segments.en: Then the householder Anāthapiṇḍika went up to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side. The Buddha said to him:

segments.pli: “Pañcime, gahapati, dhammā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā dullabhā lokasmiṃ.
segments.en: “Householder, these five things that are likable, desirable, and agreeable are hard to get in the world.

segments.pli: Katame pañca?
segments.en: What five?

segments.pli: Āyu, gahapati, iṭṭho kanto manāpo dullabho lokasmiṃ;
segments.en: Long life,

segments.pli: vaṇṇo iṭṭho kanto manāpo dullabho lokasmiṃ;
segments.en: beauty,

segments.pli: sukhaṃ iṭṭhaṃ kantaṃ manāpaṃ dullabhaṃ lokasmiṃ;
segments.en: happiness,

segments.pli: yaso iṭṭho kanto manāpo dullabho lokasmiṃ;
segments.en: fame,

segments.pli: saggā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā dullabhā lokasmiṃ.
segments.en: and heaven.

segments.pli: Ime kho, gahapati, pañca dhammā iṭṭhā kantā manāpā dullabhā lokasmiṃ.
segments.en: These are the five things that are likable, desirable, and agreeable, but hard to get in the world.

segments.pli: Imesaṃ kho, gahapati, pañcannaṃ dhammānaṃ iṭṭhānaṃ kantānaṃ manāpānaṃ dullabhānaṃ lokasmiṃ na āyācanahetu vā patthanāhetu vā paṭilābhaṃ vadāmi.
segments.en: And I say that these five things are not got by praying or wishing for them.

segments.pli: Imesaṃ kho, gahapati, pañcannaṃ dhammānaṃ iṭṭhānaṃ kantānaṃ manāpānaṃ dullabhānaṃ lokasmiṃ āyācanahetu vā patthanāhetu vā paṭilābho abhavissa, ko idha kena hāyetha?
segments.en: If they were, who would lack them?

segments.pli: Na kho, gahapati, arahati ariyasāvako āyukāmo āyuṃ āyācituṃ vā abhinandituṃ vā āyussa vāpi hetu.
segments.en: A noble disciple who wants to live long ought not pray for it, or hope for it, or pine for it.

segments.pli: Āyukāmena, gahapati, ariyasāvakena āyusaṃvattanikā paṭipadā paṭipajjitabbā.
segments.en: Instead, they should practice the way that leads to long life.

segments.pli: Āyusaṃvattanikā hissa paṭipadā paṭipannā āyupaṭilābhāya saṃvattati.
segments.en: For by practicing that way they gain long life

segments.pli: So lābhī hoti āyussa dibbassa vā mānusassa vā.
segments.en: as a god or a human being.

segments.pli: Na kho, gahapati, arahati ariyasāvako vaṇṇakāmo vaṇṇaṃ āyācituṃ vā abhinandituṃ vā vaṇṇassa vāpi hetu.
segments.en: A noble disciple who wants to be beautiful ought not pray for it, or hope for it, or pine for it.

segments.pli: Vaṇṇakāmena, gahapati, ariyasāvakena vaṇṇasaṃvattanikā paṭipadā paṭipajjitabbā.
segments.en: Instead, they should practice the way that leads to beauty.

segments.pli: Vaṇṇasaṃvattanikā hissa paṭipadā paṭipannā vaṇṇapaṭilābhāya saṃvattati.
segments.en: For by practicing that way they gain beauty

segments.pli: So lābhī hoti vaṇṇassa dibbassa vā mānusassa vā.
segments.en: as a god or a human being.

segments.pli: Na kho, gahapati, arahati ariyasāvako sukhakāmo sukhaṃ āyācituṃ vā abhinandituṃ vā sukhassa vāpi hetu.
segments.en: A noble disciple who wants to be happy ought not pray for it, or hope for it, or pine for it.

segments.pli: Sukhakāmena, gahapati, ariyasāvakena sukhasaṃvattanikā paṭipadā paṭipajjitabbā.
segments.en: Instead, they should practice the way that leads to happiness.

segments.pli: Sukhasaṃvattanikā hissa paṭipadā paṭipannā sukhapaṭilābhāya saṃvattati.
segments.en: For by practicing that way they gain happiness

segments.pli: So lābhī hoti sukhassa dibbassa vā mānusassa vā.
segments.en: as a god or a human being.

segments.pli: Na kho, gahapati, arahati ariyasāvako yasakāmo yasaṃ āyācituṃ vā abhinandituṃ vā yasassa vāpi hetu.
segments.en: A noble disciple who wants to be famous ought not pray for it, or hope for it, or pine for it.

segments.pli: Yasakāmena, gahapati, ariyasāvakena yasasaṃvattanikā paṭipadā paṭipajjitabbā.
segments.en: Instead, they should practice the way that leads to fame.

segments.pli: Yasasaṃvattanikā hissa paṭipadā paṭipannā yasapaṭilābhāya saṃvattati.
segments.en: For by practicing that way they gain fame

segments.pli: So lābhī hoti yasassa dibbassa vā mānusassa vā.
segments.en: as a god or a human being.

segments.pli: Na kho, gahapati, arahati ariyasāvako saggakāmo saggaṃ āyācituṃ vā abhinandituṃ vā saggānaṃ vāpi hetu.
segments.en: A noble disciple who wants to go to heaven ought not pray for it, or hope for it, or pine for it.

segments.pli: Saggakāmena, gahapati, ariyasāvakena saggasaṃvattanikā paṭipadā paṭipajjitabbā.
segments.en: Instead, they should practice the way that leads to heaven.

segments.pli: Saggasaṃvattanikā hissa paṭipadā paṭipannā saggapaṭilābhāya saṃvattati.
segments.en: For by practicing that way they gain heaven,

segments.pli: So lābhī hoti saggānanti.
segments.en: they are one who gains the heavens.

segments.pli: Āyuṃ vaṇṇaṃ yasaṃ kittiṃ,
segments.en: For one who desires a continuous flow

segments.pli: Saggaṃ uccākulīnataṃ;
segments.en: of exceptional delights—

segments.pli: Ratiyo patthayānena,
segments.en: long life, beauty, fame and reputation,

segments.pli: Uḷārā aparāparā.
segments.en: heaven, and birth in an eminent family—

segments.pli: Appamādaṃ pasaṃsanti,
segments.en: the astute praise diligence

segments.pli: puññakiriyāsu paṇḍitā;
segments.en: in making merit.

segments.pli: Appamatto ubho atthe,
segments.en: Being diligent, an astute person

segments.pli: adhigaṇhāti paṇḍito.
segments.en: secures both benefits:

segments.pli: Diṭṭhe dhamme ca yo attho,
segments.en: the benefit in this life,

segments.pli: yo cattho samparāyiko;
segments.en: and in lives to come.

segments.pli: Atthābhisamayā dhīro,
segments.en: A wise one, comprehending the meaning,

segments.pli: paṇḍitoti pavuccatī”ti.
segments.en: is called ‘astute’.”

segments.pli: Tatiyaṃ.

sections.title: Then the householder Anāthapiṇḍika went up to the Buddha,…

suttaplex.blurb: You don’t get good things by praying for them, but by how you live.
